pageContext.claim: “It's my strong opinion that the forewoman of the jury -- the woman who was in charge of the jury [in Roger Stone’s trial] -- is totally tainted. When you take a look, how can you have a person like this? She was a anti-Trump activist. Can you imagine this? … Now, I don't know if this is a fact, but she had a horrible social media account. The things she said on the account were unbelievable. She didn't reveal that when she was chosen.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump attacked the jury foreperson in the Roger Stone case, alleging without evidence that she failed to disclose anti-Trump bias. One of the jurors in the trial, Seth Cousins, wrote in a Washington Post op-ed that the foreperson "was actually one of the strongest advocates for the rights of the defendant and for a rigorous process. She expressed skepticism at some of the government’s claims and was one of the last people to vote to convict on the charge that took most of our deliberation time."
